page.title: 08Local Churches.
page.content: {St. Nicholas, Newtown,}is Church of England, 100 years old, and run by two priests, being one of three parishes operated by a team ministry helped by laity. The congregation is drawn from the whole of the Newbury area, with large attendances at Easter, Christmas etc.. 16 baptisms, 7 weddings and 5 funerals were conducted last year. {Francis de Sales R.C. Church}is 150 to 200 years old, its congregation drawn from South West Newbury. Groups flourish in all age ranges, and lay people assist in all activities. Fund raising takes many forms; bazaars, fetes, and collections all helping. All the churches expect the different denominations to draw closer together in the future, and probably to provide facilities and a local focal point for people of all beliefs or none.
